pullRequest.title: [insteon] support Dimmer/Switch Beep and LED On/Off as well as Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Bat
pullRequest.bodyText:
[insteon] support Dimmer/Switch Beep and LED On/Off as well as Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Bat
This PR provides is a new functionality to the new Insteon binding by adding channels to Dimmers/Siwtches for Beep and LED On/Off as well as adding channels to motions sensors for Dawn/Dusk and Low Battery warning.  This also updates the README.md docs to include these changes.
Here is a link to my .jar for testing purposes:
https://mega.nz/#!zRwzXDiS!AjeYW8n5ftnxtXEljrW4Z57rxngrj4b5fyw4GXK6M9w

commit.message:
Added Beep and LED On/Off to dimmers switches (and keypad dimmers and switches).  Also added Dawn/Dusk and LowBattery to motion detectors.

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Beep and LED On/Off as channels

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Beep and LED On/Off channels to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Added Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Batt as channels and to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

beforeCommit.message: Added Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Batt as channels and to README.md

afterCommit.message:
Added Motion Sensor Dawn/Dusk and Low Batt as channels and to README.md

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: so the last three bytes of the message are 0?
Is this variable used anymore then?
Can you change "Makes Device Beep" to "Beep"

+| beep | Switch | Makes Device Beep |

nodes.bodyText: Can we use something more generic than "dawndusk"? This assumes that the variable is associated with the sun rise/set
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -131,6 +132,7 @@ In order to determine which channels a device supports, you can look at the devi
 | broadcastOnOff | Switch | Broadcast On/Off |
 | contact | Contact | Contact |
 | coolSetPoint | Number | Cool Set Point |
+| dawndusk | Contact | Light Sensor above or below threshold |

nodes.bodyText:
lowbat -> lowBattery
Momentary trip on motion sensor low battery warning -> Low Battery
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -156,12 +158,14 @@ In order to determine which channels a device supports, you can look at the devi
 | kWh | Number | Kilowatt Hour |
 | lastHeardFrom | DateTime | Last Heard From |
 | ledBrightness | Number | LED brightness |
+| ledOnOff | Switch | LED On/Off |
 | lightDimmer | Dimmer | light Dimmer |
 | lightLevel | Number | Light Level |
 | loadDimmer | Dimmer | Load Dimmer |
 | loadSwitch | Switch | Load Switch |
 | loadSwitchFastOnOff | Switch | Load Switch Fast On/Off |
 | loadSwitchManualChange | Number | Load Switch Manual Change |
+| lowbat | Contact | Momentary trip on motion sensor low battery warning |

nodes.bodyText: Can we use something more generic than "dawndusk"? This assumes that the variable is associated with the sun rise/set.
public static final String LOW_BATTERY= "lowBattery";
I assume this was accidental? Eclipse formatting produces the original formatting.

commit.message:
Changed a few variable names to better match standard and removed commented out code.

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

Chnged variable for light sensor above threshold to betther match standard and fixed formatting to better match standard

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

commit.message:
Changed WirelessMotionSensorLightlevelabovethreshold to WirelessMotionSensorLightLevelAboveThreshold per request

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -403,6 +403,26 @@
 	<command-handler command="OnOffType">NoOpCommandHandler</command-handler>
 	<poll-handler>NoPollHandler</poll-handler>
 </feature>
+<feature name="WirelessMotionSensorLightLevelAboveThreshold">
+	<message-dispatcher>DefaultDispatcher</message-dispatcher>
+	<message-handler cmd="0x03" group="2">NoOpMsgHandler</message-handler>
+	<message-handler cmd="0x11" group="2">OpenedSleepingContactHandler</message-handler>
+	<message-handler cmd="0x13" group="2">ClosedSleepingContactHandler</message-handler>
+	<message-handler cmd="0x19">NoOpMsgHandler</message-handler>
+	<message-handler cmd="0x2e">NoOpMsgHandler</message-handler>
+	<command-handler command="OnOffType">NoOpCommandHandler</command-handler>
+	<poll-handler>NoPollHandler</poll-handler>
+</feature>
+<feature name="WirelessMotionSensorLowbattery">

commit.message:
Changed WirelessMotionSensorLowbattery to WirelessMotionSensorLowBattery per request

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: Lets make this consistent with the documentation. It has "Light Level Above/Below Threshold"

+

+		<item-type>Contact</item-type>
+		<label>Light Light Level Above Threshold</label>

+		<label>Low Battery Warning</label>

Added some formatting changes to ensure docs match code and to al code to match Eclipse formatting

Signed-off-by: Tom Weichmann <tommycw10@gmail.com>
